result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry J Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Consecutive to: to 14CM730 and any other sentence defendant may be serving, if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Defendant granted 60 days to pay, failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered.

-Same conditions as 14CM730:
-Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.  
-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
-No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-No contact with Faith Peterson unless approved by the agent and family coordinates child visitation.
-Submit DNA surcharge.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Larry J Miller in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty, renders sentence. Court is informed there is no restitution on this case.
